```{R}
library("osfr")
```

```{R}
# Generate a PAT (Personal Access Token) from your OSF account and paste it here.
# OSF settings => Personal Access Token (Create Token)
#Token = "B3Rh8EQRuAIL3m5PF64SCiWkutdszf0XADu7FDNPf8duN6NyTaaoaRWCIur8q0p17fJ1kb"
#QHlNrnngJm1Qer1yff5IfvFNwhpdYgkmSL36PewF5insnUgGOnq9tfj7Bo3fBJX6Iy7Nwq

#"B3Rh8EQRuAIL3m5PF64SCiWkutdszf0XADu7FDNPf8duN6NyTaaoaRWCIur8q0p17fJ1kb"
# Authenticate
osf_auth("B3Rh8EQRuAIL3m5PF64SCiWkutdszf0XADu7FDNPf8duN6NyTaaoaRWCIur8q0p17fJ1kb")

# project url id / GUID (global unique identifier)
# eg. for Savant OSF Project https://osf.io/feh9r/ => url_id/GUID/node = "feh9r" | N.B GUID would always be a 5 alphanummeric sting

GUID = "f7tn4"

# retrive project node
project <- osf_retrieve_node("f7tn4")
```
```{R}
osf_upload(project, path = "upload/Stimuli/" , recurse = TRUE, progress = TRUE,conflicts = "skip",verbose = TRUE)

```

\`\`\`{R} \# OSF Upload \# osf_upload(node,"filepath/to/local/machine") \# If there exists subfolders use recurse = TRUE or recurse = X, where X is a postive number denoting subfolder levels \# You can also use progress = TRUE, which will show a progress bar for files upload \# NB in case of recursive folders, OSFr will first create a the folder structures and then populate/upload the files.

osf_upload(project,"/media/swarmoi/QM-Drive/Dropbox/SM-Projects/Number-Syncretism/middleton-moitra-britishAcademy/upload/Stimuli", recurse = TRUE, progress = TRUE, verbose = TRUE)

# If you want to upload your working directory then use this

# osf_upload(project, ".", recurse = TRUE, progress = TRUE)
